RE:01.title: Design for redundancy
RE:01.description: Design your workload to be redundant across zones and regions as appropriate. Build in redundancy to eliminate single points of failure.
RE:01.content: Design your application architecture to be zone-redundant when possible and region-redundant when necessary. Set up redundancy for single points of failure including management and control plane components. Implement automated failover mechanisms and test them regularly to ensure they work as expected during actual outages.

RE:02.title: Identify flows
RE:02.description: Identify and catalog critical system flows to understand dependencies and failure modes.
RE:02.content: Document all critical system flows including data flows, API call chains, and inter-service dependencies. Use this catalog to perform failure mode analysis and identify potential weak points in your architecture.

RE:03.title: Use failure mode analysis
RE:03.description: Conduct failure mode analysis to identify and mitigate potential failure points.
RE:03.content: Perform comprehensive failure mode and effects analysis (FMEA) on your system. Identify single points of failure, cascading failure scenarios, and implement mitigations such as circuit breakers, bulkheads, and graceful degradation patterns.

RE:04.title: Define reliability targets
RE:04.description: Establish clear reliability targets including SLOs, SLAs, and SLIs for your workload.
RE:04.content: Define service level objectives (SLOs), service level agreements (SLAs), and service level indicators (SLIs) for your workload. Set recovery time objectives (RTO) and recovery point objectives (RPO) based on business requirements. Monitor these metrics continuously and adjust your architecture to meet them.

RE:05.title: Strengthen resiliency and recoverability
RE:05.description: Implement patterns and practices that strengthen system resiliency and enable rapid recovery.
RE:05.content: Implement retry policies with exponential backoff, circuit breakers, and timeout strategies. Design for graceful degradation when dependencies fail. Implement health checks and automated recovery procedures. Test recovery procedures regularly through chaos engineering.

RE:06.title: Use data replication
RE:06.description: Implement appropriate data replication strategies to ensure data durability and availability.
RE:06.content: Configure data replication across availability zones and regions based on your RPO and RTO requirements. Use geo-replication for critical data. Implement proper backup strategies with automated testing of restore procedures. Consider using Azure Site Recovery for disaster recovery scenarios.

RE:07.title: Use background jobs
RE:07.description: Offload long-running and non-critical operations to background jobs to improve responsiveness.
RE:07.content: Use message queues and background workers to handle asynchronous operations. Implement idempotent message processing. Use dead-letter queues for failed messages. Monitor queue depths and processing times to identify bottlenecks.

RE:08.title: Design a reliability testing strategy
RE:08.description: Implement comprehensive testing including chaos engineering to validate reliability.
RE:08.content: Conduct regular reliability testing including load testing, stress testing, and chaos engineering experiments. Test failover procedures, backup and restore operations, and disaster recovery plans. Use Azure Chaos Studio to inject failures and validate system behavior.

RE:09.title: Implement disaster recovery
RE:09.description: Design and implement disaster recovery procedures to handle regional outages.
RE:09.content: Establish disaster recovery procedures for regional failures. Implement automated failover to secondary regions. Regularly test DR procedures to ensure they work as expected. Document runbooks for disaster recovery scenarios and train operations teams.

RE:10.title: Monitor infrastructure
RE:10.description: Implement comprehensive monitoring to detect and respond to reliability issues.
RE:10.content: Use Azure Monitor to track system health, availability metrics, and performance indicators. Set up alerts for anomalies and threshold breaches. Implement distributed tracing to diagnose issues across microservices. Use Application Insights for application-level monitoring.

SE:01.title: Establish a security baseline
SE:01.description: Define and enforce a security baseline for your workload aligned with organizational policies.
SE:01.content: Establish security baselines using Azure Policy and Microsoft Defender for Cloud. Implement Azure security benchmarks. Regularly review and update security baselines to address evolving threats. Use Microsoft Defender for Cloud Secure Score to track security posture.

SE:02.title: Maintain a secure development lifecycle
SE:02.description: Integrate security practices throughout the software development lifecycle.
SE:02.content: Implement secure coding practices and conduct security code reviews. Use static application security testing (SAST) and dynamic application security testing (DAST). Scan dependencies for vulnerabilities. Implement security gates in CI/CD pipelines using tools like GitHub Advanced Security.

SE:03.title: Classify and protect data
SE:03.description: Classify data based on sensitivity and apply appropriate protection mechanisms.
SE:03.content: Classify data based on sensitivity and compliance requirements. Apply appropriate encryption for data at rest and in transit. Use Azure Information Protection for data classification and protection. Implement data loss prevention (DLP) policies. Regularly audit data access and usage.

SE:04.title: Create segmentation and perimeters
SE:04.description: Implement network segmentation and security perimeters to limit blast radius.
SE:04.content: Use virtual networks, subnets, and network security groups to create security boundaries. Implement micro-segmentation using application security groups. Use Azure Firewall or third-party network virtual appliances. Follow zero-trust principles with explicit verification at each layer.

SE:05.title: Manage identity and access
SE:05.description: Implement robust identity and access management with least privilege principles.
SE:05.content: Use Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) for identity management. Implement role-based access control (RBAC) with least privilege. Use managed identities for Azure resources. Enforce multi-factor authentication (MFA). Implement Privileged Identity Management (PIM) for privileged access. Regularly review access rights.

SE:06.title: Isolate network traffic
SE:06.description: Implement network isolation to protect sensitive workloads and data.
SE:06.content: Use virtual network peering and private endpoints to isolate traffic. Implement Azure Private Link for PaaS services. Use service endpoints where private endpoints are not available. Avoid exposing services directly to the internet. Use application gateways and load balancers as security choke points.

SE:07.title: Encrypt data
SE:07.description: Implement encryption for data at rest, in transit, and in use.
SE:07.content: Enable encryption for all Azure services. Use TLS 1.2 or higher for data in transit. Use Azure Key Vault for key management. Consider using customer-managed keys for sensitive data. Implement Azure Disk Encryption for VM disks. Use transparent data encryption (TDE) for databases.

SE:08.title: Harden resources
SE:08.description: Apply security hardening to all resources following industry best practices.
SE:08.content: Apply OS hardening using CIS benchmarks. Disable unnecessary services and ports. Keep systems patched using Azure Update Management. Use just-in-time (JIT) VM access. Implement endpoint protection using Microsoft Defender for Endpoint. Regular vulnerability assessments.

SE:09.title: Protect application secrets
SE:09.description: Store and manage application secrets securely using proper secret management services.
SE:09.content: Store secrets, certificates, and keys in Azure Key Vault. Use managed identities to access Key Vault. Never store secrets in code or configuration files. Rotate secrets regularly. Use Key Vault references in App Service and Function Apps. Implement secret scanning in repositories.

SE:10.title: Monitor and detect threats
SE:10.description: Implement comprehensive security monitoring and threat detection.
SE:10.content: Enable Microsoft Defender for Cloud for all subscriptions. Use Azure Sentinel for security information and event management (SIEM). Configure diagnostic logging for all resources. Monitor for suspicious activities and anomalies. Implement threat intelligence integration. Set up automated response for common threats.

SE:11.title: Establish incident response procedures
SE:11.description: Define and test incident response procedures for security events.
SE:11.content: Develop and document incident response plans. Define roles and responsibilities for security incidents. Establish communication protocols. Conduct regular tabletop exercises. Use Azure Sentinel playbooks for automated response. Maintain forensic capabilities for post-incident analysis.

SE:12.title: Test security defenses
SE:12.description: Regularly test security controls through penetration testing and security assessments.
SE:12.content: Conduct regular penetration testing and vulnerability assessments. Perform red team/blue team exercises. Test incident response procedures. Use Azure Security Center recommendations to identify weaknesses. Implement bug bounty programs for external security researchers.

CO:01.title: Create a culture of financial responsibility
CO:01.description: Establish organizational practices that promote cost awareness and accountability.
CO:01.content: Foster cost awareness across development and operations teams. Implement cost tagging strategies for resource attribution. Establish cost budgets and alerts. Create showback or chargeback models. Hold regular cost review meetings with stakeholders.

CO:02.title: Establish a cost model
CO:02.description: Create a comprehensive cost model for your workload to track and predict spending.
CO:02.content: Build detailed cost models that map resources to business units and applications. Use Azure Cost Management to track spending. Implement resource tagging for cost allocation. Create forecasts and budgets based on historical data and growth projections.

CO:03.title: Collect and review cost data
CO:03.description: Regularly collect and analyze cost data to identify optimization opportunities.
CO:03.content: Use Azure Cost Management and Azure Advisor for cost insights. Export cost data for detailed analysis. Review spending trends monthly. Identify cost anomalies and investigate promptly. Use Azure Cost Management APIs for custom reporting.

CO:04.title: Set spending guardrails
CO:04.description: Implement policies and controls to prevent unexpected cost overruns.
CO:04.content: Use Azure Policy to enforce resource SKU restrictions. Implement spending limits and alerts. Use Azure Cost Management budgets with action groups. Restrict who can create expensive resources. Implement approval workflows for large resource provisioning.

CO:05.title: Get the best rates from providers
CO:05.description: Leverage pricing models and commitments to reduce infrastructure costs.
CO:05.content: Use Azure Reservations for predictable workloads (1-year or 3-year commitments). Leverage Azure Hybrid Benefit for Windows Server and SQL Server. Use Azure Savings Plans for compute. Take advantage of spot VMs for interruptible workloads. Negotiate enterprise agreements for volume discounts.

CO:06.title: Align usage to billing increments
CO:06.description: Optimize resource usage to match billing units and minimize waste.
CO:06.content: Understand billing increments for Azure services. Consolidate workloads to reduce per-unit costs. Use auto-scaling to match demand. Shut down non-production resources during off-hours. Right-size resources to avoid paying for unused capacity.

CO:07.title: Optimize component costs
CO:07.description: Review and optimize costs for individual Azure components and services.
CO:07.content: Use Azure Advisor recommendations for cost optimization. Right-size VMs based on actual utilization. Use cheaper storage tiers for infrequently accessed data. Optimize database configurations. Delete unused resources like unattached disks and old snapshots.

CO:08.title: Optimize environment costs
CO:08.description: Reduce costs by optimizing non-production environments.
CO:08.content: Use smaller SKUs for non-production environments. Shut down dev/test resources outside business hours using Azure Automation. Use Azure Dev/Test subscriptions for discounted rates. Share resources across environments where possible. Use ephemeral environments that are created and destroyed on demand.

CO:09.title: Optimize flow costs
CO:09.description: Reduce costs associated with data movement and network traffic.
CO:09.content: Minimize cross-region data transfers. Use Azure CDN to reduce origin traffic. Implement data compression. Use Azure Front Door for global routing efficiency. Optimize API call patterns to reduce unnecessary requests. Use caching to minimize backend calls.

CO:10.title: Optimize data costs
CO:10.description: Implement strategies to reduce data storage and processing costs.
CO:10.content: Use appropriate storage tiers (Hot, Cool, Archive) based on access patterns. Implement lifecycle management policies to automatically transition data. Delete obsolete data. Compress data where appropriate. Use Azure Blob Storage reserved capacity for predictable storage needs.

CO:11.title: Optimize code costs
CO:11.description: Improve code efficiency to reduce compute and resource consumption.
CO:11.content: Profile application performance to identify inefficiencies. Optimize database queries. Reduce memory footprint. Use asynchronous operations to improve throughput. Optimize container image sizes. Use serverless compute where appropriate to pay only for actual usage.

CO:12.title: Optimize scaling costs
CO:12.description: Implement cost-effective scaling strategies that match demand patterns.
CO:12.content: Use auto-scaling based on metrics that reflect actual demand. Implement scheduled scaling for predictable patterns. Use scale-to-zero for serverless services. Consider using Azure Functions consumption plan for event-driven workloads. Use application-level caching to reduce backend scaling needs.

CO:13.title: Optimize personnel time
CO:13.description: Reduce operational costs by improving team efficiency and automation.
CO:13.content: Automate repetitive tasks to free up team capacity. Use infrastructure as code to improve deployment efficiency. Implement self-service capabilities for developers. Use Azure Automation and Logic Apps for operational tasks. Invest in monitoring and alerting to reduce mean time to recovery (MTTR).

CO:14.title: Consolidate resources
CO:14.description: Reduce costs through resource consolidation and multi-tenancy where appropriate.
CO:14.content: Consolidate multiple small databases into elastic pools. Use multi-tenant architectures where appropriate. Share infrastructure across applications. Use container orchestration to improve resource utilization. Consolidate monitoring and logging infrastructure.

OE:01.title: Determine workload team members needs
OE:01.description: Identify and provide resources, training, and tools needed by the workload team.
OE:01.content: Assess team skills and identify training needs. Provide access to necessary tools and resources. Establish clear roles and responsibilities. Foster a culture of continuous learning. Invest in certifications and professional development for team members.

OE:02.title: Formalize the way you run routine and nonroutine tasks
OE:02.description: Document and standardize operational procedures and runbooks.
OE:02.content: Create comprehensive runbooks for operational tasks. Document incident response procedures. Standardize deployment processes. Establish change management processes. Use Azure Automation for routine tasks. Maintain up-to-date operational documentation.

OE:03.title: Formalize software development management practices
OE:03.description: Implement structured software development lifecycle practices.
OE:03.content: Adopt agile development practices. Implement code review processes. Use version control for all artifacts. Establish branching strategies. Define definition of done criteria. Use work item tracking systems. Conduct regular retrospectives.

OE:04.title: Optimize software development and quality assurance processes
OE:04.description: Continuously improve development and testing practices for better quality.
OE:04.content: Implement automated testing (unit, integration, end-to-end). Use continuous integration to catch issues early. Implement test-driven development (TDD) practices. Conduct load and performance testing. Use code quality tools and enforce standards. Implement shift-left security practices.

OE:05.title: Prepare resources and their configurations
OE:05.description: Use infrastructure as code and configuration management for consistency.
OE:05.content: Use infrastructure as code (Bicep, Terraform, ARM templates). Store IaC in version control. Implement automated validation and testing of infrastructure code. Use Azure Policy for governance. Implement configuration drift detection. Use Azure Blueprints for standardized environments.

OE:06.title: Design a workload supply chain
OE:06.description: Establish secure and reliable pipelines for building and deploying software.
OE:06.content: Implement CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions. Secure the software supply chain. Use artifact management. Implement dependency scanning. Sign and verify artifacts. Use separate pipelines for different environments. Implement approval gates for production deployments.

OE:07.title: Design a deployment failure mitigation strategy
OE:07.description: Implement strategies to detect and mitigate deployment failures quickly.
OE:07.content: Implement blue-green or canary deployments. Use feature flags to control rollout. Implement automated rollback capabilities. Monitor key metrics during deployments. Use deployment rings to gradually roll out changes. Test rollback procedures regularly.

OE:08.title: Design an emergency response strategy
OE:08.description: Establish procedures for responding to critical incidents and outages.
OE:08.content: Develop incident response plans for various scenarios. Establish on-call rotations and escalation procedures. Use incident management tools. Conduct post-incident reviews (blameless post-mortems). Maintain communication channels for incidents. Practice emergency procedures through game days.

OE:09.title: Automate all tasks
OE:09.description: Identify and automate manual operational tasks to reduce errors and improve efficiency.
OE:09.content: Identify repetitive manual tasks for automation. Use Azure Automation for operational tasks. Implement self-healing capabilities. Use Azure Logic Apps for workflow automation. Automate scaling operations. Create automated reports and dashboards.

OE:10.title: Design and implement automation
OE:10.description: Build robust automation that is maintainable and testable.
OE:10.content: Write automation code with the same rigor as application code. Use version control for automation scripts. Implement error handling in automation. Test automation in non-production environments. Document automation workflows. Use idempotent operations. Implement logging and monitoring for automation.

OE:11.title: Use safe deployment practices
OE:11.description: Implement deployment strategies that minimize risk and enable quick recovery.
OE:11.content: Use progressive exposure deployment patterns (canary, blue-green, ring-based). Implement automated testing in deployment pipelines. Monitor key metrics during rollout. Have rollback procedures ready. Use feature flags for runtime control. Deploy during low-traffic periods. Communicate deployment schedules to stakeholders.

PE:01.title: Negotiate realistic performance targets
PE:01.description: Establish measurable and achievable performance targets based on business requirements.
PE:01.content: Define performance requirements early in the design phase. Establish latency, throughput, and concurrency targets. Set realistic SLOs based on business needs and technical constraints. Document performance requirements for each critical flow. Balance performance targets with cost considerations.

PE:02.title: Conduct capacity planning
PE:02.description: Plan for current and future capacity needs to ensure performance at scale.
PE:02.content: Analyze current and projected workload patterns. Plan for growth and seasonal variations. Conduct load testing to understand capacity limits. Monitor resource utilization trends. Use Azure Monitor capacity planning features. Plan for burst capacity needs.

PE:03.title: Select the right services
PE:03.description: Choose Azure services that best match your performance requirements.
PE:03.content: Evaluate Azure services based on performance characteristics. Use premium SKUs when performance justifies the cost. Choose appropriate compute options (VMs, containers, serverless). Select database services that match access patterns. Use Azure service SLAs as a guide for reliability and performance expectations.

PE:04.title: Collect performance data
PE:04.description: Implement comprehensive performance monitoring and telemetry.
PE:04.content: Use Azure Monitor and Application Insights for performance telemetry. Track key performance indicators (response time, throughput, error rates). Implement distributed tracing for microservices. Use performance counters and metrics. Set up dashboards for real-time performance visibility. Establish baselines for normal performance.

PE:05.title: Optimize scaling
PE:05.description: Implement effective scaling strategies to maintain performance under varying load.
PE:05.content: Use auto-scaling based on appropriate metrics (CPU, memory, queue depth, custom metrics). Implement horizontal scaling for stateless components. Use vertical scaling judiciously for stateful components. Pre-warm resources for predictable load spikes. Use Azure Front Door or Traffic Manager for global load distribution.

PE:06.title: Optimize data usage
PE:06.description: Implement efficient data access patterns and storage strategies.
PE:06.content: Use appropriate data storage services for access patterns. Implement data partitioning and sharding strategies. Use read replicas for read-heavy workloads. Minimize data movement across regions. Implement appropriate indexing strategies. Use data compression where appropriate.

PE:07.title: Optimize code
PE:07.description: Write efficient code that minimizes resource consumption and maximizes throughput.
PE:07.content: Profile application code to identify bottlenecks. Optimize expensive operations and algorithms. Use asynchronous programming patterns. Minimize blocking operations. Optimize memory usage and garbage collection. Use connection pooling for database and HTTP connections. Implement efficient serialization.

PE:08.title: Optimize data access
PE:08.description: Implement caching and efficient data access patterns to reduce latency.
PE:08.content: Implement caching at multiple levels (CDN, application, database). Use Azure Cache for Redis for distributed caching. Implement cache-aside pattern for database access. Use appropriate cache eviction policies. Minimize database round trips through batching. Use stored procedures or materialized views for complex queries.

PE:09.title: Prioritize network performance
PE:09.description: Optimize network architecture and configuration for low latency and high throughput.
PE:09.content: Use Azure regions closest to users. Implement Azure Front Door or CDN for global distribution. Use ExpressRoute for consistent network performance. Enable accelerated networking on VMs. Optimize network topology to minimize hops. Use private endpoints to avoid internet routing.

PE:10.title: Optimize operational tasks
PE:10.description: Ensure operational activities don't negatively impact application performance.
PE:10.content: Schedule maintenance tasks during low-traffic periods. Use snapshot backups to minimize impact. Implement index maintenance strategies that don't block operations. Use read replicas for reporting queries. Optimize log collection and retention. Use sampling for high-volume telemetry.

PE:11.title: Respond to live performance issues
PE:11.description: Establish processes to detect and respond quickly to performance degradation.
PE:11.content: Set up performance alerts with appropriate thresholds. Implement automated responses for common issues. Have runbooks ready for performance incidents. Use Azure Monitor autoscale for automatic adjustments. Maintain performance baselines to detect anomalies. Practice performance incident response through game days.

PE:12.title: Continuously optimize performance
PE:12.description: Establish a culture of continuous performance improvement and optimization.
PE:12.content: Regularly review performance metrics and trends. Conduct periodic load testing and performance reviews. Stay updated on Azure service improvements and new features. Optimize based on actual usage patterns. Implement performance regression testing in CI/CD. Share performance insights across teams.
